meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, the teacher decided to rescoring the tests.
meanings.sent2: The company will be rescoring the performance of all employees next month.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit kept rescoring the magic tricks, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The athlete felt like he was rescoring his personal best with each practice session.
meanings.sent5: The artist kept rescoring the painting until it was perfect.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning a new score to something
meanings.sent1: The rescoring of the exam results led to a change in the final grades.
meanings.sent2: There was a discrepancy in the rescoring of the competition results.
meanings.sent3: The rescoring of the game's leaderboard caused quite a stir among the players.
meanings.sent4: The rescoring of the movie ratings revealed a surprising shift in audience preferences.
meanings.sent5: The rescoring of the music competition brought new opportunities for talented musicians.
